fields.summary: Support search attribute aliasing for system and pre-defined attributes (without CHASM)

issuetype.description: A small, distinct piece of work.
issuetype.name: Task

content.text: to help unblock CHASM use cases and general devx improvements.
We synced and we defined the behavior as:
If the search attribute in the query has a
prefix, skip mapping to a custom search attribute
If the search attribute exists in the visibility mapper, pass it through
Otherwise, if it exists as a system or pre-defined attribute, map it
Note that some pre-defined attributes are already defined with the
prefix, need to check both options
In the future, we will also need to lookup in the CHASM archetype search attribute mapping
We said that this mapping should be done before the persistence layer to avoid duplicating the code for every persistence implementation.
When we support per-namespace mapping for ES, this should plug into the proposed solution.
Also need to verify this works on Cloud.
The list-filter documentation will need to be updated as well. This feature will be available from server version 1.30 and greater

fields.summary: [GA] Utilize stamps for standalone-activities

issuetype.description: A small, distinct piece of work.
issuetype.name: Task

content.text: Activities have a concept of a
that is used to invalidate tasks when an activity attempt is increased, a reset happens, or the activity options are updated.
We need to copy this for standalone activities.
We have a couple of options:
a field on the activity struct that is incremented when relevant
a checksum a computed field - e.g. a deterministic function that takes all of the relevant fields as inputs
Leaning towards the latter because it eliminates the possibility of forgetting to update the stamp when a field is mutated.

fields.summary: [Jan] Support selecting write partition by activity ID in saas-temporal matching client

issuetype.description: A small, distinct piece of work.
issuetype.name: Task

content.text: Temporal Cloud uses a multi-cassandra setup which requires extra logic when picking a task queue write partition. Currently this relies on sharding by workflow ID. We will need to update this logic to support sharding by activity ID (and, in general, any other CHASM component entity ID).
(might not be required for standalone activities but uses the same logic, so double check)

fields.summary: Standalone Activity: unify attempt completion and overall activity completion time

issuetype.description: A small, distinct piece of work.
issuetype.name: Task

content.text: Currently we have activity attempts that keep their own completion time. This will only get set if an attempt is actually made, including retries. Cancellation and termination do not touch attempt fields as a means to preserve failure info. However, we also have activity info fields related to the overall “completion” of an activity, namely
. We do not have a persistence field for the overall activity completion. We would expect the CloseTime,
to be set for any closed state, including cancellation and termination. Workflows today set close time upon cancel and terminated as well.
- Add a field to the activity state called
. This will be set on transition to any terminal state, including cancel, terminated, and timeout.

fields.summary: COGS analysis

issuetype.description: A small, distinct piece of work.
issuetype.name: Task

content.text: As discussed we need a full COGS analysis to get pricing approval for Standalone Activities. This will be a
I'm not seeing this tracked on the
, but we discussed doing it as part of pre-release load testing
can we get a Jira ticket & Dev Plan entry for this, so it's done as soon as Pre-release can be load tested on Cloud?
PRD: Standalone Activity Cost Saving & Margin Improvements
at a minimum we need to know the full Cloud costs for operating Standalone Activities
not just DB writes, but including
... everything required to provide the service
for the initial test and can we model what it will be?
Run a Standalone Activity (no retries/heartbeats) - Astra + WAL, compute, etc.
considering allowing visibility to be disabled later for lower cost post-GA
Retry & Heartbeat costs would be nice to have if possible
Ideally vs. a full Workflow + Activity for COGS comparison
As noted above: this has become a top priority for Samar and LT
priority/fairness plan for how to assess COGS
(there may be a more up to date doc, would check with that team)
given Standalone Activities is a tier-1 feature, we'll need something on-par with priority/fairness
